ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] re: Class Balance
ygData.msgSnippet: You should definitely get her to learn Bind Wounds.  The lone true tank still in my Bards main group can heal like mad with those things.  The magician just
ygData.messageBody:
You should definitely get her to learn Bind Wounds. The lone true tank
still in my Bards main group can heal like mad with those things. The
magician just summons them up and she Binds anyone seriously hurt, ok, ok
she binds me, all right. She can heal 2 bubbles so fast its frightening,
and all without mana, hmmm.

Kit

-----Original Message-----
From: Perhaps a Princess... [mailto:sarah@...]
Sent: Thursday, March 16, 2000 10:44 AM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: RE: [eqbards] re: Class Balance


From: "Perhaps a Princess..." <sarah@...>

Ah. That makes sense. My regular group is me and a monk. And we rely on
the monk's Mend. (She keeps promising to learn Bind Wound and keeps
forgetting)

Last night we had a real good adventure with a warrior and wizard who also
adventured together. The four of us did ReALLY good in Mistmoore. I just
wish it wasn't so late!
Sarah Heacock sarah@...
Faerain Wanderer, level 20 Soldier of Tunare, Phoenix, Solusek Ro /
Faesong, level 15 HalfElf Bard of Solusek Ro, Phoenix, Solusek Ro (Freeport)
/
Meara, level 14 Enchanter, Master Jeweler, owner Meara's Boutique of
Mystiques, Phoenix, Solusek Ro /
<lvl 4 paladin>
>From: "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@...>
>
>I'm lucky in that my druid's main group already includes two clerics. I'm
>only the emergency healer, and am the secondary nuker. I am
>generally right
>there waded in swinging away and nuking/DoTing as I can get them in. I
>rarely get hit till the poor bard needs to back out or flee.
